Class PwMarkerLayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.phunware.mapping.PwMarkerLayer

    PwMapViewLayer

    public class PwMarkerLayer
extends java.lang.Object
implements PwMapViewLayer
    Add markers on this layer

    • Constructor Detail

      • PwMarkerLayer

        public PwMarkerLayer()
        Create a new marker layer. This should be added onto a PwMapView with PwMapView.addLayer(PwMapViewLayer).

    • Method Detail

      • addMarker

        public void addMarker(PwMarker marker)
        Add a marker to the layer. This will not add duplicate markers. The comparison is based on PwMarker.equals(Object). Null markers will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        marker - Marker to add.

      • removeMarker

        public boolean removeMarker(PwMarker marker)
        Remove a marker from the list if present.
        Parameters:
        marker - Marker to remove.
        Returns:
        True if the marker was removed, false if not.

      • removeAllMarkers

        public void removeAllMarkers()
        Remove all markers in the layer.

      • getMarkers

        public java.util.ArrayList<PwMarker> getMarkers()
        Get all markers in this layer.
        Returns:
        List of all markers.

      • onDraw

        public void onDraw(android.content.Context context,
          android.graphics.Canvas canvas,
          PwCoordinateSpace coordinateSpace,
          int zoomLevel,
          android.content.res.Resources res)
        Description copied from interface: PwMapViewLayer
        Use the canvas given here to draw on top of the canvas. This will draw on top of the map. The map will provide all interaction implementations such as rotation, translation, or scaling.

        The coordinateSpace should be used to convert map coordinates to the canvas' coordinates.

        Specified by:
        onDraw in interface PwMapViewLayer
        Parameters:
        context - Current context
        canvas - Canvas to draw on.
        coordinateSpace - The coordinate space of the map.
        zoomLevel - The current zoom level (1..5).
        res - Resources to help draw with.

      • onTouchUp

        public boolean onTouchUp(android.graphics.PointF mapPoint,
                android.graphics.PointF touchPoint)
        Description copied from interface: PwMapViewLayer
        Called when the user lifts a pointer from the screen. For example, when a user presses on the screen that is considered a touch down event and when the user lifts that finger it is considered a touch up. This is called when the last pointer has lifted from the screen.
        Specified by:
        onTouchUp in interface PwMapViewLayer
        Parameters:
        mapPoint - The point on the map that was touched.
        touchPoint - The point on the view that was touched. This should always be on the screen.
        Returns:
        True if the event is handled here and should not propagate to other layers. False if the event is not handled or the event should still propagate to other layers.

      • onTouchDown

        public boolean onTouchDown(android.graphics.PointF mapPoint,
                  android.graphics.PointF touchPoint)
        Description copied from interface: PwMapViewLayer
        Called when the user touches a pointer on the screen. If multiple pointers enter the screen then this is called only for the first pointer. Once all pointers are removed then this may be called again for the next pointer that enters.
        Specified by:
        onTouchDown in interface PwMapViewLayer
        Parameters:
        mapPoint - The point on the map that was touched.
        touchPoint - The point on the view that was touched. This should always be on the screen.
        Returns:
        True if the event is handled here and should not propagate to other layers. False if the event is not handled or the event should still propagate to other layers.

      • onCreate

        public void onCreate(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState,
            PwMapView pwMapView)
        Description copied from interface: PwMapViewLayer
        Called from the activities onCreate method. This is called after the MapView is initialized and is loading, or when this layer is first added to the map view.
        Specified by:
        onCreate in interface PwMapViewLayer
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - Saved state bundle. Contains anything saved in PwMapViewLayer.onSaveInstanceState(android.os.Bundle).
        pwMapView - The map view that this layer is attached to.
